entries.meaning: The lack, absence, or antithesis of grace; gracelessness.
examples: The evil ungraces of the wicked Devil are thus called in Latin speech:  […]

verbs.description: ungrace (third-person singular simple present ungraces, present participle ungracing, simple past and past participle ungraced)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To undo or remove grace; render grace ineffective; make ungraceful or ungracious.
examples: It is another one of those experiences of ungracing the grace of God and putting boundaries, putting dogmas, putting creeds around the grace of God that ungraces the grace of God.
